trans-unit.source: About Storage Analytics Metrics
trans-unit.target: About Storage Analytics Metrics

trans-unit.source: Storage Analytics can store metrics that include aggregated transaction statistics and capacity data about requests to a storage service.
trans-unit.target: Storage Analytics can store metrics that include aggregated transaction statistics and capacity data about requests to a storage service.

trans-unit.source: Transactions are reported at both the API operation level as well as at the storage service level, and capacity is reported at the storage service level.
trans-unit.target: Transactions are reported at both the API operation level as well as at the storage service level, and capacity is reported at the storage service level.

trans-unit.source: Metrics data can be used to analyze storage service usage, diagnose issues with requests made against the storage service, and to improve the performance of applications that use a service.
trans-unit.target: Metrics data can be used to analyze storage service usage, diagnose issues with requests made against the storage service, and to improve the performance of applications that use a service.

trans-unit.source: To use Storage Analytics, you must enable it individually for each service you want to monitor.
trans-unit.target: To use Storage Analytics, you must enable it individually for each service you want to monitor.

trans-unit.source: You can enable it from the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>; for details, see <externalLink><linkText>How To Monitor a Storage Account</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/storage/how-to-monitor-a-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can enable it from the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>; for details, see <externalLink><linkText>How To Monitor a Storage Account</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/storage/how-to-monitor-a-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable Storage Analytics programmatically via the REST API or the client library.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable Storage Analytics programmatically via the REST API or the client library.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link xlink:href="96701530-7f68-4933-864a-3c019b00288f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Service Properties (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="9e42d151-d7eb-40fb-b3ef-ee1b57f83f0f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Queue Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and <link xlink:href="99806684-7d33-4a59-acc2-23aaf460eb31" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table Service Properties (REST API)</link> operations to enable Storage Analytics for each service.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link xlink:href="96701530-7f68-4933-864a-3c019b00288f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Service Properties (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="9e42d151-d7eb-40fb-b3ef-ee1b57f83f0f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Queue Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and <link xlink:href="99806684-7d33-4a59-acc2-23aaf460eb31" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table Service Properties (REST API)</link> operations to enable Storage Analytics for each service.

trans-unit.source: Transaction Metrics
trans-unit.target: Transaction Metrics

trans-unit.source: A robust set of data is recorded at hourly or minute intervals for each storage service and requested API operation, including ingress/egress, availability, errors, and categorized request percentages.
trans-unit.target: A robust set of data is recorded at hourly or minute intervals for each storage service and requested API operation, including ingress/egress, availability, errors, and categorized request percentages.

trans-unit.source: You can see a complete list of the transaction details in the <link xlink:href="2f3eea75-7291-4d2c-aeb1-11cbb51a0793" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Metrics Table Schema</link> topic.
trans-unit.target: You can see a complete list of the transaction details in the <link xlink:href="2f3eea75-7291-4d2c-aeb1-11cbb51a0793" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Metrics Table Schema</link> topic.

trans-unit.source: Transaction data is recorded at two levels – the service level and the API operation level.
trans-unit.target: Transaction data is recorded at two levels – the service level and the API operation level.

trans-unit.source: At the service level, statistics summarizing all requested API operations are written to a table entity every hour even if no requests were made to the service.
trans-unit.target: At the service level, statistics summarizing all requested API operations are written to a table entity every hour even if no requests were made to the service.

trans-unit.source: At the API operation level, statistics are only written to an entity if the operation was requested within that hour.
trans-unit.target: At the API operation level, statistics are only written to an entity if the operation was requested within that hour.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you perform a <system>GetBlob</system> operation on your Blob service, Storage Analytics Metrics will log the request and include it in the aggregated data for both the Blob service as well as the <system>GetBlob</system> operation.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you perform a <system>GetBlob</system> operation on your Blob service, Storage Analytics Metrics will log the request and include it in the aggregated data for both the Blob service as well as the <system>GetBlob</system> operation.

trans-unit.source: However, if no <system>GetBlob</system> operation is requested during the hour, an entity will not be written to the <legacyItalic>$MetricsTransactionsBlob</legacyItalic> for that operation.
trans-unit.target: However, if no <system>GetBlob</system> operation is requested during the hour, an entity will not be written to the <legacyItalic>$MetricsTransactionsBlob</legacyItalic> for that operation.

trans-unit.source: Transaction metrics are recorded for both user requests and requests made by Storage Analytics itself.
trans-unit.target: Transaction metrics are recorded for both user requests and requests made by Storage Analytics itself.

trans-unit.source: For example, requests by Storage Analytics to write logs and table entities are recorded.
trans-unit.target: For example, requests by Storage Analytics to write logs and table entities are recorded.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how these requests are billed, see <link xlink:href="26c306dd-7188-4d72-a5da-33173c364ac9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Billing and Data Retention Policies for Storage Analytics</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information on how these requests are billed, see <link xlink:href="26c306dd-7188-4d72-a5da-33173c364ac9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Billing and Data Retention Policies for Storage Analytics</link>

trans-unit.source: Capacity Metrics
trans-unit.target: Capacity Metrics

trans-unit.source: Currently, capacity metrics are only available for the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: Currently, capacity metrics are only available for the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: Capacity metrics for the Table service and Queue service will be available in future versions of Storage Analytics.
trans-unit.target: Capacity metrics for the Table service and Queue service will be available in future versions of Storage Analytics.

trans-unit.source: Capacity data is recorded daily for a storage account’s Blob service, and two table entities are written.
trans-unit.target: Capacity data is recorded daily for a storage account’s Blob service, and two table entities are written.

trans-unit.source: One entity provides statistics for user data, and the other provides statistics about the <codeInline>$logs</codeInline> blob container used by Storage Analytics.
trans-unit.target: One entity provides statistics for user data, and the other provides statistics about the <codeInline>$logs</codeInline> blob container used by Storage Analytics.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyItalic>$MetricsCapacityBlob</legacyItalic> table includes the following statistics:
trans-unit.target: The <legacyItalic>$MetricsCapacityBlob</legacyItalic> table includes the following statistics:

trans-unit.source: <system>Capacity</system>: The amount of storage used by the storage account’s Blob service, in bytes.
trans-unit.target: <system>Capacity</system>: The amount of storage used by the storage account’s Blob service, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: <system>ContainerCount</system>: The number of blob containers in the storage account’s Blob service.
trans-unit.target: <system>ContainerCount</system>: The number of blob containers in the storage account’s Blob service.

trans-unit.source: <system>ObjectCount</system>: The number of committed and uncommitted block or page blobs in the storage account’s Blob service.
trans-unit.target: <system>ObjectCount</system>: The number of committed and uncommitted block or page blobs in the storage account’s Blob service.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the capacity metrics, see <link xlink:href="2f3eea75-7291-4d2c-aeb1-11cbb51a0793" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Metrics Table Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the capacity metrics, see <link xlink:href="2f3eea75-7291-4d2c-aeb1-11cbb51a0793" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Metrics Table Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: How Metrics Are Stored
trans-unit.target: How Metrics Are Stored

trans-unit.source: All metrics data for each of the storage services is stored in three tables reserved for that service: one table for transaction information, one table for minute transaction information, and another table for capacity information.
trans-unit.target: All metrics data for each of the storage services is stored in three tables reserved for that service: one table for transaction information, one table for minute transaction information, and another table for capacity information.

trans-unit.source: Transaction and minute transaction information consists of request and response data, and capacity information consists of storage usage data.
trans-unit.target: Transaction and minute transaction information consists of request and response data, and capacity information consists of storage usage data.

trans-unit.source: Hour metrics, minute metrics, and capacity for a storage account’s Blob service is can be accessed in tables that are named as described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Hour metrics, minute metrics, and capacity for a storage account’s Blob service is can be accessed in tables that are named as described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Metrics Level
trans-unit.target: Metrics Level

trans-unit.target: Table Names

trans-unit.target: Supported for Versions

trans-unit.target: $MetricsTransactionsBlob

trans-unit.source: $MetricsTransactionsQueue
trans-unit.target: $MetricsTransactionsQueue

trans-unit.source: Versions prior to 2013-08-15 only.
trans-unit.target: Versions prior to 2013-08-15 only.

trans-unit.source: While these names are still supported, it’s recommended that you switch to using the tables listed below.
trans-unit.target: While these names are still supported, it’s recommended that you switch to using the tables listed below.

trans-unit.source: $MetricsCapacityBlob
trans-unit.target: $MetricsCapacityBlob

trans-unit.source: All versions, including 2013-08-15
trans-unit.target: All versions, including 2013-08-15

trans-unit.source: These tables are automatically created when Storage Analytics is enabled for a storage account.
trans-unit.target: These tables are automatically created when Storage Analytics is enabled for a storage account.

trans-unit.source: They are accessed via the namespace of the storage account, for example: <codeInline>https://%%amp;lt;accountname%%amp;gt;.table.core.windows.net/Tables("$MetricsTransactionsBlob")</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: They are accessed via the namespace of the storage account, for example: <codeInline>https://%%amp;lt;accountname%%amp;gt;.table.core.windows.net/Tables("$MetricsTransactionsBlob")</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Accessing Metrics Data
trans-unit.target: Accessing Metrics Data

trans-unit.source: All data in the metrics tables can be accessed by using the Table service APIs, including the .NET APIs provided by the Azure managed library.
trans-unit.target: All data in the metrics tables can be accessed by using the Table service APIs, including the .NET APIs provided by the Azure managed library.

trans-unit.source: The storage account administrator can read and delete table entities, but cannot create or update them.
trans-unit.target: The storage account administrator can read and delete table entities, but cannot create or update them.
